# maxVertexAmplificationCount

**Instance Property**

The maximum vertex amplification count you can set when encoding render commands.

## Declaration

```swift
var maxVertexAmplificationCount: Int { get set }
```

## Discussion

Before setting this property, call the [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLDevice/supportsVertexAmplificationCount(_:)] method on the device object to determine whether that amplification count is supported.

## Related Documentation

- **setVertexAmplificationCount(_:viewMappings:)**: Configures the number of output vertices the render pipeline produces for each input vertex, optionally with render target and viewport offsets.
- **supportsVertexAmplificationCount(_:)**: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the GPU supports an amplification factor.
